course.title: The Python Bibleâ„¢ | Everything You Need to Program in Python
course.subtitle: Build 11 Projects and go from Beginner to Pro in Python with the World's Most Fun Project-Based Python Course!

reviews.body: I would recommend this course for one who has absolutely no idea about programming like me. This course is amazing.
This course is very good. The teacher makes it simple, clear and easy to understand all the concepts. I really recommend it to Python beginners who want to leverage their skills.

A good course worth going through a couple of times. There are a few concepts that I needed to find additional resources for (e.g. list comprehension) because they weren't explained beyond the definition. It would be really helpful to sometimes give multiple examples of when to use different functions/methods beyond what we used in the projects. Otherwise, the projects were great.

I was absolute beginner when I started this course. Ziyad is a great teacher. He explained things clearly and very easy to understand. If you want to learn Python, don't hesitate. Choose this course. You will not regret.
He moved very fast towards the end, but you can always pause the video. I thought the course was very good. Be sure to practice on your spare time.

Ziyad's energy keeps you focused and makes this course a fun hands-on, beginner-friendly course! I think a few more quizzes in the later sections would be a nice future addition, if there are any further updates. Overall, a short and sweet, enjoyable course with a great high-level view of the concepts, with quizzes and projects along the way!

The teacher is exceptional, goes into detail, positive spirit that makes you smile even when it gets hard. Only but, is he walked more lightly over constructors, and the other advanced stuff at the end of the course. Still the best Python course I have bought! Learned me a lot the others failed to do!
First of all it was a perfect course! The best thing I liked was the projects in the course
Tremendous efforts from the instructor. Many thanks for such an organized and beautiful course for #print("all the beautiful people of the world!")

I enjoyed the class very much and I learned a lot. But thought the last two sections went by very fast. I would of like to see more test and exercises in these sections to get a better grasp of the concepts.
This course is a very good jump off point in learning Python. The course is very instructive and engaging. The instructor is very clear on his explanation and very engaging.

It was the perfect course for me as it wasn't very long and I had next to zero experience in programming before I joined. I took this course because I had just recently grown an interest in computer programming and was looking to gain some knowledge and experience to see whether I would like to take a course at my university. The Instructor is a little too fast to keep up with at times but overall I have taken in a lot of knowledge and come away with some valuable experience, thank you very much!

instructor.name: Ziyad Yehia
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Hi there, I'm Ziyad! I am a Udemy Instructor with over 150,000 students and I specialize in getting beginner level students up and running with Python and Linux with my highly effective project-based approach. 

I previously taught computing to students at a UK-based international college and now put my full efforts into providing an outstanding learning experience to students around the world on Udemy.

I am best known for my results-driven teaching as well as my clear, energetic delivery. If you like to learn things quickly and thoroughly and like to have loads of fun on the way, then I cannot wait to work with you and help you to achieve your goals!
